# 2018-03: No Matter How You Slice It

```{r}
library(data.table)
library(stringi)
dt <- readLines("input.txt")
dt <- data.table(do.call(rbind, stri_match_all_regex(dt, "#([0-9]{1,4}) @ ([0-9]{0,4}),([0-9]{0,4}): ([0-9]{0,4})x([0-9]{0,4})")))
colnames(dt) <- c("input", "id", "xPos", "yPos", "xSize", "ySize")
dt <- data.table(apply(dt[, 2:6], 2, as.numeric))
head(dt)
```

## Part 1

```{r}
mat <- matrix(0, 1000, 1000)
for(x in 1:nrow(dt)) {
  xPos <- dt$xPos[x] + 1
  xSize <- dt$xSize[x] - 1
  yPos <- dt$yPos[x] + 1
  ySize <- dt$ySize[x] - 1
  mat[xPos:(xPos + xSize), yPos:(yPos + ySize)] <- mat[xPos:(xPos + xSize), yPos:(yPos + ySize)] + 1
}
length(mat[mat >= 2])
```

## Part 2

```{r}
for(x in 1:nrow(dt)) {
  xPos <- dt$xPos[x] + 1
  xSize <- dt$xSize[x] - 1
  yPos <- dt$yPos[x] + 1
  ySize <- dt$ySize[x] - 1
  if (all(mat[xPos:(xPos + xSize), yPos:(yPos + ySize)] == 1)) { print(x) }
}
```
